intro: Dorstenia cuspidata var. antsingiae, commonly known as the Antsingai false banana, is a unique member of the family Malvaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the leaves of a banana plant. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated by enthusiasts and conservationists.
